intro: This country has a stable and successful economy and one of the most open business and investment policies in the world. This is why many international companies have established part of their business there.The Netherlands has historically played a key role in international tax planning; the country offers a wide range of instruments that allow an ample array of tax advantages for both non-resident companies and individuals in the country.The following are some of the many corporate vehicles available in this new jurisdiction:• The Dutch Foundation (“Stichting”)• The Dutch Private Limited Company or B.V. (“Besloten Vennootschap”)• The Dutch Limited Partnerships, also known as Dutch CVs (“Commanditaire Vennootschap”)This country heads the ranks as to capital flow from all over the world, together with Ireland, Luxembourg and Switzerland. It offers beneficial conditions, particularly concerning double taxation and investment agreements, for the use of Netherlands companies in the structuring of international financial transactions, especially for holding companies, which grants multiple benefits to international multinational companies.HIGHLIGHTS OF THE NETHERLANDSSOCIAL AND ECONOMIC INDICATORSLocation:Western Europe, bordering the North Sea, between Belgium and GermanyArea: 41,543 sq kmPopulation: 16,805,037 (July 2013 est.)Climate: TemperateOfficial Language: Dutch (official) and EnglishGovernment: Constitutional MonarchyLiving Standard: HighBanking: Worldwide banking facilities availableLegal Tender: EURO (EUR)Industries: Tourism, Industry, Agriculture and Services.
highlights: Member of the OECD, World Trade Organization (WTO), International Monetary Fund (IMF), among others.
Founding member of the European Union
Dutch law has an advanced legal system
Large double tax and information agreements network
